com.anand.sudoku.solver

Class DriverClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.anand.sudoku.solver.DriverClass

  • public class DriverClass
extends java.lang.Object
    Driver Class in the main class accepting the sudoku board dimensions and sudoku data. The class is capable of reading input from both file and STDIN. Once the data is read and validated, a sudoku Solver is initialized and begins to solve the puzzle.
    Author:
    A Anand

      • main

      • readFromFile

        private void readFromFile(java.io.BufferedReader in)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          InvalidBoardStyleException,
                          InvalidSudokuPuzzleException,
                          InvalidSolutionTypeException
        Method reads a sudoku puzzle from the sudokuPuzzleInput.txt file, validates the input read an creates a concatenated string to sudoku rows. The format of sudokuPuzzleInput.txt is
        • Size of the sudoku board (no of rows and no of columns)
        • Row size of the inner box
        • Column size of the inner box
        • BoardStyle: Style in which board data will be provided. Each entry of the sudoku board needs to be separated by a single space
          Possible Values:
          1. Each Row of the puzzle is entered in different line
          2. Entire puzzle input is provided in single line.
        • Sudoku board data in one line or n lines where n is the number of rows in the sudoku board
        • SolutionType: Type of the solution Required.
          Possible Values:
          1. Single solution: Find a single solution for the puzzle and stop the program
          2. All Solutions: Find all possible solutions to the puzzle.
        Parameters:
        in - The buffered reader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs while reading input data
        InvalidBoardStyleException - if the board style specified is not valid
        InvalidSudokuPuzzleException - if the sudoku board data entered is invalid
        InvalidSolutionTypeException - if the solution type required in invalid

      • readFromStandardInput

        private void readFromStandardInput(java.io.BufferedReader in)
                            throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                   java.io.IOException,
                                   InvalidSudokuPuzzleException,
                                   InvalidSolutionTypeException,
                                   InvalidBoardStyleException
        Method reads a sudoku puzzle from the STDIN, validates the input read an creates a concatenated string to sudoku rows. The various data needed for the application are
        • Size of the sudoku board (no of rows and no of columns)
        • Row size of the inner box
        • Column size of the inner box
        • BoardStyle: Style in which board data will be provided. Each entry of the sudoku board needs to be separated by a single space
          Possible Values:
          1. Each Row of the puzzle is entered in different line
          2. Entire puzzle input is provided in single line.
        • Sudoku board data in one line or n lines where n is the number of rows in the sudoku board
        • SolutionType: Type of the solution Required.
          Possible Values:
          1. Single solution: Find a single solution for the puzzle and stop the program
          2. All Solutions: Find all possible solutions to the puzzle.
        Parameters:
        in - The buffered reader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs while reading input data
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if any size entered is not a valid number
        InvalidBoardStyleException - if the board style specified is not valid
        InvalidSudokuPuzzleException - if the sudoku board data entered is invalid
        InvalidSolutionTypeException - if the solution type required in invalid

      • readOneRowPerLine

        private void readOneRowPerLine(java.io.BufferedReader in)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads the sudoku board data line by line. The method will be invoked only if the BoardStyle is SolverConstants.ONE_ROW_PER_LINE
        Parameters:
        in - The buffered reader from which data needs to be read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs while reading input data

      • validateBoardStyle

        private void validateBoardStyle(int boardStyle)
                         throws InvalidBoardStyleException
        This method validates the entered BoardStyle.The possible values are
        1. SolverConstants.ONE_ROW_PER_LINE
        2. SolverConstants.ENTIRE_BOARD_ONE_LINE
        Parameters:
        boardStyle - the board style received from input which needs to be validated
        Throws:
        InvalidBoardStyleException - if board style is less than 0 or greater than the total number of board styles

      • validateSolutionType

        private void validateSolutionType()
                           throws InvalidSolutionTypeException
        This method validates the entered SolutionType. The possible values are
        1. SolverConstants.SINGLE_SOLUTION
        2. SolverConstants.ALL_SOLUTIONS
        Throws:
        InvalidSolutionTypeException - if solution type entered is less than 0 or greater than the total number of solution types

      • validatePuzzleInput

        private void validatePuzzleInput()
                          throws InvalidSudokuPuzzleException
        This method validates the sudoku board data read from the input.
        Throws:
        InvalidSudokuPuzzleException - if the entered data is not a valid sudoku data as per the dimensions provided

      • displayIntro

        private void displayIntro()
        Method Displays Intro Text for the application
